The paper proposes a learning-based approach to control synthesis for Markov decision processes (MDPs) with linear temporal logic (LTL) specifications. This involves constructing a product MDP that incorporates a deterministic Rabin automaton generated from the desired LTL property, and defining the reward function of the product MDP from the acceptance condition of the Rabin automaton. The paper applies techniques from learning theory to the problem of synthesis for LTL specifications, even when the transition probabilities are not known a priori. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.RO (Robotics). Additionally, the paper deals with control synthesis, which falls under the sub-category cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper proposes a method for synthesizing policies that satisfy LTL specifications, which is related to the sub-category cs.PL (Programming Languages).
